alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 8:09PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in northern New Jersey... Warren. In Pennsylvania...Monroe and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring across portions of the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amount of 0.5 to 1 inches are possible within the next two hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Belvidere, Hope, East Bangor, Delaware Water Gap, Columbia, Echo Lake, Werry Lake, and Roxburg. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 314. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
